p: The rhizome has a relatively higher antioxidant activity than the leaves and petiole of both species ( Table 2), with the IC 50 values varying between 47.08 and 473.04 mg/mL. C. latifolia rhizome has demonstrated the highest antioxidant activity, whereas the leaves of C. orchioides shows the second-highest antioxidant activity. The inhibitory concentration of α-glucosidase inhibitor from separated parts of the plant shows a different pattern with the values of IC 50 varying from 155.25 to 553.38 mg/mL. The C. latifolia extract from the rhizome and leaves parts showed the highest α-glucosidase inhibitory activity among the other extracts from Sinjai-Puncak (RLSK and LLSK). Meanwhile, the C. orchioides extract from leaves and rhizome parts showed a weak effect as an inhibitor for α-glucosidase activity.
